definition: one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven/male principle/☰/ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)

sentences.english: The horse is champing his hay.
Hay yield is highest from the dough stage to the stage of yellow maturity.
sentences.chinese: 乾草產量以蠟熟末至黃熟期爲最高。

sentences.english: Every one takes it from bottom of the rack.
sentences.chinese: 每隻羊都從乾草架底喫草。

sentences.english: The Haymarket incident was a source of outrage from people around the globe.
sentences.chinese: 的乾草市場事件是地球源周圍憤怒的市民。

sentences.english: Of insects in the windrows of the hay.
sentences.chinese: 在乾草中嗡嗡不息的吵鬧？

sentences.english: He's under the haycock, fast asleep.
He was then placed in a barn and filled with hay.
sentences.chinese: 然後被放置在牲口棚裏，裝滿了乾草。

sentences.english: My long scythe whispered and left the hay to make.
sentences.chinese: 我的長鐮低語，離開一堆堆乾草。

sentences.english: Good haymaking weather comes in late May.
sentences.chinese: 五月下旬出現適於調製乾草的好天氣。
這堆乾草可是無窮龐大。

sentences.english: The townsmen grabbed their guns and their pitchforks and ran toward the witch.
sentences.chinese: 市民劫掠了他們的槍和他們的乾草叉並且跑了往巫婆。

sentences.english: Getting in the hay would be something grandpa couldn't do by himself.
sentences.chinese: 把乾草收進來外公一個人是幹不了的。

sentences.english: De boys up in de hayloft.
Help me haul the hay bales into the barn.
sentences.chinese: 幫我把這些乾草捆拖到穀倉裏。

definition: to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
joss paper made to resemble paper money
